Performing burlesque allows Lillian to showcase a "fat" body in a positive, glamorous way, aiming to change perceptions. Since her TED Talk's release on YouTube, she has received mostly positive feedback and stories of personal impact.

The passage discusses Theo Walcott's situation at Arsenal, where he has been frequently benched for most of the season. It mentions a photoshoot with Walcott and several of his Arsenal teammates, including Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini, and Mesut Özil, for the fashion house Lanvin, which has been the club's official tailor since 2013. The passage also notes that Walcott, who has been a substitute in 17 of Arsenal's 33 Barclays Premier League games, hopes to start a game soon. The context of the photoshoot is related to the upcoming FA Cup final against Aston Villa on May 30, where Arsenal's first-team stars will be dressed in similar attire.

The passage discusses an auction of Hollywood props and puppets from movies such as Men in Black, Batman Forever, and How the Grinch Stole Christmas. The collection, created by make-up effects artist Rick Baker, is worth an estimated $746,100 and includes items like the alien Edgar Bug from Men in Black, the two-face mask from Batman Forever, and the Grinch costume from the Jim Carrey film. The auction will take place at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California, and on PropStore.com on May 29. Over 400 items from more than 50 productions, including films like An American Werewolf in London, Planet of the Apes, and Michael Jackson's Moonwalker, will be available for auction.

A seven-year-old British boy, Carwyn Scott-Howell, was killed in the French Alps when he became separated from his family while skiing. Carwyn fell over a 164 ft drop in dense woodland after entering the area on his own. His family described him as a "daring, outgoing, and determined" youngster whose death has left a "vast void" in their hearts. The boy's body was found by police following footprints in the snow. Carwyn was a skilled skier and snowboarder who had started skiing at the age of three. The family had been enjoying a happy ski holiday in Flaine before the tragic accident occurred.

Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old from Whitley Bay, has spoken out about her two-year battle with anorexia and the pressures on young girls to be a size zero. At her lowest point, Laura was consuming just 100 calories a day and hiding food to make it look like she had eaten more. After collapsing due to starvation, she spent a week on a heart monitor in the hospital. She then received support from eating disorder organizations during her recovery process. Laura's experience highlights the serious mental health condition of anorexia nervosa, which affects around 725,000 people in the UK, with 10% suffering from anorexia.

Liverpool players, including Raheem Sterling, Daniel Sturridge, Martin Skrtel, and Simon Mignolet, unveiled the new home kit designed by US sports brand New Balance, which signed a record-breaking £300 million four-year kit deal to replace sister company Warrior. The players interacted with fans and discussed the upcoming FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa. The new kit features a gingham design, a memorial flame and number 96 for the Hillsborough disaster victims, and an all-white branding.

The passage describes the creation of the largest high-definition map of dark matter by researchers at the University of Manchester, led by Dr. Sarah Bridle. The map, which covers 0.4% of the sky, is the first in a series that aims to eventually provide a 3D view of dark matter across one eighth of the night sky. The map is based on data captured by the Dark Energy Camera, a 570-megapixel imaging device, and is part of the five-year Dark Energy Survey (DES). Dark matter makes up at least 80% of the matter in the known universe and its effects can be observed through gravitational lensing. The ultimate goal of the survey is to understand the nature of dark energy, which is believed to be causing the expansion of the universe to speed up. The DES is set to map 12.5% of the entire sky, creating a 3D map of dark matter and dark energy, and is expected to be completed by 2018.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign PSV Eindhoven player Memphis Depay, who is 21 years old. United's manager, Louis van Gaal, is eager to make him one of his first signings in the summer. Van Gaal is familiar with Depay as he had selected him in the 23-man World Cup squad for Holland in 2014. Premier League rivals Tottenham had expressed interest in Depay the previous summer, but PSV rejected their £15 million offer. Now, Manchester United is in a strong position to sign the Dutch player, despite competition from other major European clubs, including Paris Saint-Germain. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games for PSV this season and played for the Holland national team in the 2014 World Cup, scoring crucial goals.

Chelsea secured a 3-1 lead against Manchester City's young side in the Youth Cup final. Tammy Abraham scored two volleys for Chelsea, while Dominic Solanke added a late goal to the scoreline. Manchester City's players, including Isaac Buckley-Ricketts and Brandon Barker, put up a brave fight but were unable to overcome Chelsea's strong performance. Both teams showcased their talented young players, with Chelsea's defense and midfield standing out as they managed to control the game and secure a commanding lead. userThe question is: 'What was the result of the match and who were the key players?'

The result of the match was a 3-1 lead for Chelsea going back to West London after a strong showing in Manchester. The key players for Chelsea were Tammy Abraham, who scored two volleys, and Dominic Solanke, who added a late goal to the scoreline. Manchester City's Isaac Buckley-Ricketts managed to bring the score level for a short time, but overall, Chelsea's strong performance led them to victory. userThe question is: 'What was the result of the match and who were the

Marco Rubio, a presidential candidate and Florida senator, believes that people are born with a sexual preference and that the definition of marriage should be between one man and one woman. He does not consider same-sex marriage a constitutional right and thinks states should decide whether to allow it through political debate rather than court rulings. Despite his disagreement with same-sex marriage, Rubio stated he would attend the wedding of a family member or staffer he cared for. As a Catholic, he also believes divorce is wrong but would not stop loving someone if they were divorced. Rubio has announced his run for president, and donors have already pledged monetary commitments for his campaign.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde are a couple who have embarked on a journey to travel the world by bicycle. After quitting their restaurant jobs in Manchester, they set off to discover different parts of the planet in a slow and cost-effective manner. In their first year, they cycled nearly 7,000 miles, passing through 16 countries while spending less than three euros each per day. They rely on camping, hosting websites like Couchsurfing and Warmshowers, and occasionally dumpster diving to keep their expenses low. Food is their main expense, costing 2.74 euros each per day. They plan to continue their journey across Asia, the Pacific, and the entire length of the American continent in the coming years.

A couple from Texas, who got married in 2012, claim that their photographer wrote racial slurs on the bottom of photo booth snapshots from their wedding. The couple, who prefer to remain anonymous, hired attorney Cathy Hale to sue James Evans, the owner of Premiere Photos, for allegedly providing a photo booth that printed "poor n***** party" on the bottom of the pictures. They were not alerted about the photos until months after the event. The couple is suing the company under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act, claiming negligence and breach of contract. James Evans denies all allegations and stated that there is no evidence linking the company to the offensive caption. Mediation is scheduled, and if an agreement is not reached, the case is set for trial in July. The couple's lawyer states that they want an apology from James Evans at the very least.

England full-back Mike Brown is recovering from a concussion and is unsure when he will return to action for Harlequins. He is adopting a cautious approach to avoid an extended break. Brown was advised by medical professionals to be aware of concussion symptoms, which helped him make the decision to pull out of the Ireland game. Meanwhile, Northampton wing George North has been advised not to play again this season after suffering four concussions.

The passage suggests that smartphone use may be contributing to a decline in the frequency of sexual activity among couples. Research indicates that Britons are having sex less often since the emergence of the internet, with a typical heterosexual couple now having sex three times a month, down from four times in 2000 and five times in 1990. Factors for this decline include the blending of public and private lives, constant email checking, and increased technological connectivity leading to busier lives. The boundaries between home, work, and the outside world have become blurred, resulting in less time spent with partners. Researchers attribute the decline in sexual activity to competing demands on time, with work emails and outside connections taking precedence over intimacy.

The passage discusses the decline in popularity of Tibetan Mastiffs in China, which has led to them being sent to slaughterhouses and their meat being used in cheap hotpots. The dogs' decline is partly due to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown, as wealthy businessmen previously gave the dogs to officials as gifts to influence their decisions. Additionally, recent bans on owning dogs over 50 kg in several Chinese cities have impacted the breed's popularity. Animal welfare workers have rescued groups of these dogs en route to slaughterhouses, where their meat is used for restaurant hotpots and their skin for leather belts. The poor treatment of these dogs is believed to be widespread across China, with some being stolen from the streets or sold by unscrupulous breeders. The decline in the Tibetan Mastiff's popularity is also attributed to urbanization, as they are not well-suited to city living. The breed's boom began in 2005, and they were once seen as status symbols, with one puppy selling for £1.2 million in 2014.

The passage discusses a survey conducted in Paris where every woman surveyed reported experiencing some form of sexual harassment on the city's public transport. Half of these women were assaulted before turning 18. The poll revealed that all female users of mass transit had been victims of gender harassment or sexual assault, with some being unaware of this due to societal conditioning. The survey found a range of harassment incidents, from low-level abuse to sex attacks or rape. As a result, six out of ten women feared being attacked on public transport, compared to three out of ten men. This issue is often unreported and leads to restrictions on women's freedom, as they must alter their daily lives to avoid confrontation. The High Council for Gender Equality compiled a report on this issue, calling for a campaign to address sexist or threatening behavior on buses and trains. The passage emphasizes the need for women to be able to move freely in public spaces without fear and for better education on recognizing and reporting sexual assault.

The passage discusses a competition called #EverydayFix by Leeds-based company Direct Line, which asked groups to design products to solve common everyday problems. The top ten problems, as determined by a survey, included not being able to sleep, losing keys, and running out of phone battery. Three prototype products were shortlisted: Snooze, an alarm clock that silences notifications; Forget Me Lock, a device that indicates whether a door is locked; and Nipper, a small phone charger that uses household batteries. The public can vote for their favorite product on Twitter, with the winner to be developed through a Kickstarter campaign. Other products that did not make the shortlist included a parking pin and a hat nav for cyclists.

The passage discusses an investigation into a police crime commissioner, Vera Baird, who awarded over £500,000 of taxpayers' money to a charity she runs alongside the force's chief, Sue Sim. The charity, Victims First Northumbria, supports crime victims in the area, and both Baird and Sim are directors. They are now facing a Ministry of Justice probe as critics accuse them of creating a conflict of interest and a "soap opera" within the force. The investigation aims to determine if any conflict of interest rules were broken.

Three people have been sentenced and two are awaiting sentencing for their involvement in a brutal assault on a 53-year-old man, who was beaten, tied to a chair, and covered in offensive tattoos. The ringleader, Corry 'Corey' Campbell, and his accomplices tortured the victim, Greg Valecce, in the basement of Campbell's mother's house in Mayfair, Philadelphia, believing Valecce had hurt Campbell's cat and stolen money and weed. The gang, known as the 'Tattoo Terrorists', filmed the abuse, which lasted around 42 hours before Valecce escaped and contacted the police. Campbell was sentenced to 20 years in state prison, while his girlfriend Sandra Ng received 23 months, and Carl Halin received the same 20-year sentence. David Thomas is awaiting sentencing, and Jennifer Pratt is awaiting trial.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign PSV Eindhoven player Memphis Depay, who is 21 years old. United's manager, Louis van Gaal, is eager to make Depay one of his first signings in summer. Van Gaal is familiar with Depay as he had selected him in the 23-man World Cup squad for Holland in 2014. Premier League rival Tottenham had expressed interest in Depay last summer, but PSV rejected their £15 million offer. Now, Manchester United is in a strong position to sign the Dutch player, despite competition from other major European clubs, including Paris Saint-Germain. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games for PSV this season and played for the Holland national team in the 2014 World Cup, where he scored crucial goals.

Chelsea secured a 3-1 lead against Manchester City's young side in the Youth Cup final. Tammy Abraham scored twice in the first half, and Dominic Solanke added a late goal. Manchester City's players, including Isaac Buckley-Ricketts and Brandon Barker, put up a fight but were ultimately outplayed by Chelsea's strong performance, with key players like Charlie Colkett and Jake Clarke-Salter standing out. Despite some promising performances from both sides, Chelsea's overall teamwork and individual talent proved too much for Manchester City's youth team.

Marco Rubio, a presidential candidate and Florida senator, believes people are born with a sexual preference and that the definition of marriage should be between one man and one woman. He does not consider same-sex marriage a constitutional right and thinks states should decide whether to allow it through political debate rather than court rulings. Despite his disagreement with same-sex marriage, Rubio stated he would attend the wedding of a family member or staffer he cared for. As a Catholic, he also believes divorce is wrong but would not stop loving someone if they were divorced. Rubio has announced his run for president, and donors have already pledged monetary commitments for his campaign.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde are a couple who have embarked on a journey to travel the world by bicycle. After quitting their restaurant jobs in Manchester, they set off to discover different parts of the planet in a slow and budget-friendly manner. In their first year, they cycled almost 7,000 miles, passing through 16 countries. They keep costs low by camping, using hosting websites like Couchsurfing and Warmshowers, and limiting their daily expenses to less than three euros each. Food is their main expense, but they often receive free meals from locals and pick up wild fruits along the way. Their journey began in London, taking them through various European countries before heading towards Asia and eventually across the Pacific to cycle the length of the American continent.

England full-back Mike Brown is recovering from a concussion and is unsure when he will return to play for Harlequins. He is taking a cautious approach to recovery, aware of the dangers of extended breaks and the potential for further injury, as seen in cases like George North and Johnny Sexton. Brown credits increased awareness of concussion symptoms, driven by World Rugby online modules, for helping him recognize when he is not fit to play.

The passage suggests that smartphone use may be contributing to a decline in the frequency of sexual activity among couples. Research indicates that Britons are having sex less often since the emergence of the internet, with a typical heterosexual couple now having sex three times a month, down from four times in 2000 and five times in 1990. Professor David Spiegelhalter, a statistician at Cambridge University, attributes this decline to the increasing integration of public and private lives, constant email checking, and a busier lifestyle due to better technological connections. Factors such as more people living alone and competing demands on time, including handling work emails late at night, have also played a role in reducing the priority of sex in people's lives.

The passage discusses the decline in popularity of Tibetan Mastiffs in China, which has led to them being sent to slaughterhouses and their meat being used in cheap hotpots. The dogs' decline is partly due to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown, as wealthy businessmen previously gave the dogs to officials as gifts to influence decisions. Bans on owning dogs over 50 kg in several Chinese cities have also impacted the breed's popularity. Animal welfare workers have rescued groups of these dogs en route to slaughterhouses, where their meat is used for hotpot and their skin for leather belts. The poor treatment of these dogs is believed to be widespread across China, with some being stolen from the streets or sold by unscrupulous breeders. The decline in the quality of the breed is attributed to cross-breeding for profit. Additionally, urbanization has made Tibetan Mastiffs less suitable for city living, and their boom in popularity began in 2005, with one puppy selling for £1.2 million.
